more.title: How the Skeleton of Mutapa Times is Based on Sarah Charlesworth's Work
more.description: Conceptual artist Sarah Charlesworth's 1979 study of how newspapers covered a solar eclipse inspired the framework behind The Mutapa Times.

more.title: Woman Arrested After Selling Mt Pleasant House And Depositing US$480K In Botswana
more.description: Harare Woman Arrested For Depositing US$48OK In Botswana After Selling Mt Pleasant House A Harare woman is in deep trouble after she allegedly sold her plush Mount Pleasant home and attempted to spirit away nearly three-quarters of the cash to Botswana, flouting the country’s exchange control laws. Sixty-five-year-old Evelyn Sarah Bengesa appeared before Harare regional magistrate [...]The post Woman Arrested After Selling Mt Pleasant House And Depositing US$480K In Botswana appeared first on iHarare News.

more.title: Zimbabwe loses to India to record second T20 World Cup defeat
more.description: The Zimbabwe senior men’s cricket team suffered their second consecutive defeat at the ongoing ICC Men’s T20 World Cup after losing by 72 runs to hosts India on Thursday at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai. The Chevrons put up a spirited fight but were ultimately outplayed by India, who posted a formidable total of [...]The post Zimbabwe loses to India to record second T20 World Cup defeat appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: UK connects Zimbabwean farmers with UK and European buyers
more.description: (Harare) – Eight buyers from the United Kingdom and European Union will visit 11 Zimbabwean farm and food businesses that have primed their horticulture products for exports through their work with the International Trade Centre (ITC). The trade mission is organised by the UK Trade Partnerships (UKTP) Programme, funded by the UK government and implemented by ITC.

more.title: Zimbabwe Govt Fires Back At Doctors Over Rejected US$367M US Health Aid Package
more.description: Zimbabwe Govt Responds After Doctors Urge Re-Engagement With US Over Rejected US$367M Health Aid Package A furious Zimbabwean government has accused the country’s top public health physicians of being “out of order” for intervening in an explosive diplomatic standoff with the United States over a rejected US$367 million (approximately R6.8 billion) health aid package. The [...]The post Zimbabwe Govt Fires Back At Doctors Over Rejected US$367M US Health Aid Package appeared first on iHarare News.

more.description: Beggars are not choosers, it is said.

more.title: US describes Zimbabwe aid cut as “regrettable” after US$367m deal collapse
more.description: HARARE – The United States (US) has announced plans to wind down its health assistance to Zimbabwe following the government’s decision to withdraw from negotiations on a proposed US$367 million health cooperation agreement, in a move Washington described as “difficult and regrettable. In a statement released by the US Embassy in Harare on Tuesday, Pamela [...]The post US describes Zimbabwe aid cut as “regrettable” after US$367m deal collapse appeared first on Nehanda Radio.

more.title: Retail giant OK Zimbabwe runs out of money and placed under corporate rescue
more.description: HARARE – OK Zimbabwe Limited has entered corporate rescue after its US$30.5 million recapitalisation plan failed to close a critical funding gap, leaving the country’s largest listed supermarket group struggling under mounting supplier debt, declining revenues and worsening liquidity constraints. The move follows stalled property disposals meant to raise US$10.5 million and growing pressure from [...]The post Retail giant OK Zimbabwe runs out of money and placed under corporate rescue appeared first on Nehanda Radio.

more.title: Chatunga Mugabe faces 15-year prison sentence in South Africa, BUT Grace Mugabe wants him back home for good
more.description: JOHANNESBURG — The youngest son of the late Zimbabwean strongman Robert Mugabe, Bellarmine Chatunga Mugabe, is currently languishing in a South African prison cell, facing a legal storm that could see him behind bars for up to 15 years. The 29-year-old, known more for his flamboyant lifestyle and champagne-drenched social media posts than for any [...]The post Chatunga Mugabe faces 15-year prison sentence in South Africa, BUT Grace Mugabe wants him back home for good first appeared on My Zimbabwe News.

more.title: Liquid Resets Finances After Debt Repayment, Secures US$410m Fresh Funding
more.description: JOHANNESBURG – Liquid Intelligent Technologies has completed a significant refinancing exercise, repaying key debt facilities while lining up new funding to support expansion across Africa’s fast-evolving digital infrastructure landscape. The company, a subsidiary of Cassava Technologies, confirmed the full repayment of its South African rand term loan and US dollar revolving credit facility, a move [...]The post Liquid Resets Finances After Debt Repayment, Secures US$410m Fresh Funding appeared first on The Zimbabwe Mail.
